cont.entity_a: Requires a big compressor with a high continuous airflow to run.
cont.entity_b: Efficient on air consumption when pressure is dialed back.

cont.entity_a: Issues with condensation build-up causing the sander to cease up.
cont.entity_b: Of excellent quality for the money.

cont.entity_a: Cuts through wood filler with no issues and leaves professional-like results.
cont.entity_b: Cuts and strips bumpers and hoods quickly.

cont.entity_a: Not suitable for a body shop.
Works much quicker than a Festool random orbit sander.
No way to attach a vacuum, so a fan is used to blow dust away.
A joy to use on large areas.

Price.comm: Excellent price for this type of tool.

cont.entity_a: Great value and works better than expected.
Needs an 80 gallon or larger compressor to run for long periods.
Not as good quality as 15 years ago, but still very good for the price.
cont.entity_b: Good quality DA sander but slows down with pressure.

cont.entity_a: Gear drive has some power and lasts long if taken care of.
cont.entity_b: Failed after 20 hours of use, but worked well while operational.

cont.entity_a: Works excellently for fiberglass refinishing projects.
cont.entity_b: Great ergonomic handle, easy to hold, and versatile.
Heavy and somewhat difficult to operate handle.
Appearance is generic and lacks rubber on the lever.
